isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - DISASSEMBLE - UPPER AND LOWER MAIN COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

svcproc.title: UPPER AND LOWER MAIN COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

figure.caption: Figure 160. Upper And Lower Main Countershaft Assemblies

note.para: The upper and lower main countershafts are serviced in the same way.
Refer to Figure 160 to identify the components of the countershaft assembly for the transmission models.

step1.para: Remove the front and rear countershaft bearings (Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Remove Front and Rear Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Put the countershaft in a press so that the main drive gear is toward the top of the press. Support the countershaft on the third or overdrive gear assembly.
Press the shaft from the third or the overdrive gear, the PTO gear and the main drive gear (Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Press Shaft From Third or Overdrive Gear, PTO Gear, and Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Support the countershaft on the first or second gear. Press the shaft from the second or the third gear and the first or the second gear (Figure 163).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Press Shaft From Second or Third Gear and First or Second Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the groove in the shaft (Figure 164).
Design Level 1 Transmissions: remove the roll pin from the shaft.
Design Level 2 Transmissions do not use a roll pin (Figure 164).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.

figure.caption: Figure 164. Remove Key From Groove and Remove Roll Pin
